alert.note: Alert for Admiralty Island; Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; City and Borough of Juneau; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 23 at 6:17AM AKST until December 24 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...SIGNIFICANT SNOWFALL FOR PARTS OF SE AK THROUGH CHRISTMAS... Multiple frontal bands will pass over the panhandle through the weekend bringing periods of snow. The first band on Friday will start with light, dry, snow tracking northward across the area. The snow will become wetter over the southern panhandle. A break or decrease in snowfall rates will occur before the second frontal band tracks northward into the southern panhandle early Saturday. This front will bring another round of snow and a chance of freezing rain. The south will change to all rain while the north sees snow tapering off or mixing with freezing rain Saturday night. ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM THIS MORNING TO 9 PM AKST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 15 inches. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph near downtown Juneau. * WHERE...North central inner channels including Gustavus, Hoonah, Tenakee Springs, Elfin Cove, Pelican, Angoon, and Juneau. * WHEN...From 9 AM this morning to 9 PM AKST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility near downtown Juneau. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Greatest snowfall rates expected Friday afternoon through Friday evening and again Saturday afternoon.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
